summary.long: Acts is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: I have made the former treatise, O Theophilus, of all that Jesus began to do and teach,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until the day that he was taken up, after that he through the holy Ghost, had given commandments unto the Apostles, whom he had chosen:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom also he presented himself alive after that he had suffered, by many infallible tokens, being seen of them by the space of forty days, and speaking of those things which appertained to the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had gathered them together, he commanded them that they should not depart from Jerusalem, but to wait for the promise of the Father, which said he, ye have heard of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John indeed baptized with water, but ye shall be baptized with the holy Ghost within these few days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they therefore were come together they asked of him, saying, Lord, wilt thou at this time restore the kingdom to Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, It is not for you to know the times, or the seasons, which the Father hath put in his own power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye shall receive power of the holy Ghost, when he shall come on you: and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem and in all Judea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was taken up: for a cloud took him up out of their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they looked steadfastly toward heaven, as he went, behold, two men stood by them in white apparel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing into heaven? This Jesus which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come, as ye have seen him go into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then returned they unto Jerusalem from the mount that is called the mount of Olives, which is near to Jerusalem, being from it a Sabbath day’s journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were come in, they went up into an upper chamber, where abode both Peter and James, and John, and Andrew, Philip, and Thomas, Bartholomew, and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon Zealot, and Judas James’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples, and said (now the number of names that were in one place were about an hundred and twenty.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye men and brethren, this scripture must needs have been fulfilled, Which the holy Ghost by the mouth of David spake before of Judas, which was guide to them that took Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was numbered with us, and had obtained fellowship in this ministration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He therefore hath purchased a field with the reward of iniquity: and when he had thrown down himself headlong, he brast asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it is known unto all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, insomuch, that that field is called in their own language, Akel Dama, that is, The field of blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written in the book of Psalms, Let his habitation be void, and let no man dwell therein: also, Let another take his charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore of these men which have companied with us, all the time that the Lord Jesus was conversant among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beginning from the baptism of John unto the day that he was taken up from us, must one of them be made a witness with us of his resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they presented two, Joseph called Barsabas, whose surname was Justus, and Matthias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they prayed, saying, Thou Lord, which knowest the hearts of all men, show whether of these two thou hast chosen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That he may take the room of this ministration and Apostleship, from which Judas hath gone astray, to go to his own place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they gave forth their lots: and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was by a common consent counted with the eleven Apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the day of Pentecost was come, they were all with one accord in one place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly there came a sound from heaven, as of a rushing and mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they sat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared unto them cloven tongues, like fire, and it sat upon each of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all filled with the holy Ghost, and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, men that feared God, of every nation under heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when this was noised, the multitude came together and were astonied, because that every man heard them speak his own language.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they wondered all, and marveled, saying among themselves, Behold, are not all these which speak, of Galilee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then hear we every man our own language, wherein we were born?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and the inhabitants of Mesopotamia, and of Judea, and of Cappadocia, of Pontus, and Asia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of Phrygia, and Pamphylia, of Egypt, and of the parts of Libya, which is beside Cyrene, and strangers of Rome, and Jews, and Proselytes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cretes, and Arabians: we heard them speak in our own tongues the wonderful works of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were all then amazed, and doubted, saying one to another, What may this be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And others mocked, and said, They are full of new wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter standing with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and said unto them, Ye men of Judea, and ye all that inhabit Jerusalem, be this known unto you, and hearken unto my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these are not drunken, as ye suppose, since it is but the third hour of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is that, which was spoken by the Prophet Joel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be in the last days, saith God, I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh, and your sons, and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on my servants, and on mine handmaids I will pour out of my Spirit in those days, and they shall prophesy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will show wonders in heaven above, and tokens in the earth beneath, blood, and fire, and the vapors of smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before that great and notable day of the Lord come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be, that whosoever shall call on the Name of the Lord, shall be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye men of Israel, hear these words, JESUS of Nazareth, a man approved of God among you with great works, and wonders, and signs, which God did by him in the midst of you, as ye yourselves also know:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Him, I say, being delivered by the determinate counsel, and foreknowledge of God, after you had taken, with wicked hands you have crucified and slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whom God hath raised up, and loosed the sorrows of death, because it was impossible that he should be holden of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David saith concerning him, I beheld the Lord always before me: for he is at my right hand, that I should not be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore did mine heart rejoice, and my tongue was glad, and moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in grave, neither wilt suffer thine Holy one to see corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast showed me the ways of life, and shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men and brethren, I may boldly speak unto you of the Patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulcher remaineth with us unto this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, seeing he was a Prophet, and knew that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of the fruit of his loins he would raise up Christ concerning the flesh, to set him upon his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He knowing this before, spake of the resurrection of Christ, that his soul should not be left in grave, neither his flesh should see corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Jesus hath God raised up, whereof we all are witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since then that he by the right hand of God hath been exalted, and hath received of his Father the promise of the holy Ghost, he hath shed forth this which ye now see and hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David is not ascended into heaven, but he saith, The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until I make thine enemies thy footstool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, let all the house of Israel know for a surety, that God hath made him both Lord, and Christ, this Jesus, I say, whom ye have crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard it, they were pricked in their hearts, and said unto Peter and the other Apostles, Men and brethren, what shall we do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said unto them, Amend your lives, and be baptized every one of you in the Name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins: and ye shall receive the gift of the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the promise is made unto you, and to your children, and to all that are afar off, even as many as the Lord our God shall call.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with many other words he besought and exhorted them, saying, Save yourselves from this [froward] generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they that gladly received his word, were baptized, and the same day there were added to the Church about three thousand souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they continued in the Apostles’ doctrine, and fellowship, and breaking of bread, and prayers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fear came upon every soul: and many wonders and signs were done by the Apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all that believed, were in one place, and had all things common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sold their possessions, and goods, and parted them to all men, as everyone had need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they continued daily with one accord in the Temple, and breaking bread at home, did eat their meat together with gladness and singleness of heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Praising God, and had favor with all the people: and the Lord added to the Church from day to day, such as should be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter and John went up together into the Temple, at the ninth hour of prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain man which was a cripple from his mother’s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the Temple called Beautiful, to ask alms of them that entered into the Temple,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who seeing Peter and John, that they would enter into the Temple, desiring to receive an alms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter earnestly beholding him with John, said, Look on us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gave heed unto them, trusting to receive some thing of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Peter, Silver and gold have I none, but such as I have, that give I thee: In the Name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, rise up and walk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took him by the right hand, and lifted him up, and immediately his feet and ankle bones received strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he leaped up, stood, and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking and leaping, and praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people saw him walk, and praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they knew him, that it was he which sat for the alms at the Beautiful gate of the Temple: and they were amazed, and sore astonied at that which was come unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as the cripple which was healed, held Peter and John, all the people ran amazed unto them in the porch which is called Solomon’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Peter saw it, he answered unto the people, Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this? or why look ye so steadfastly on us, as though by our own power or godliness, we had made this man go?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers hath glorified his Son Jesus, whom ye betrayed, and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had judged him to be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye denied the Holy one and the just, and desired a murderer to be given you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And killed the Lord of life, whom God hath raised from the dead, whereof we are witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his Name hath made this man sound, whom ye see and know, through faith in his Name: and the faith which is by him, hath given to him this perfect health of his whole body in the presence of you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now brethren, I know that through ignorance ye did it, as did also your governors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those things, which God before had showed by the mouth of all his Prophets, that Christ should suffer, he hath thus fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amend your lives therefore, and turn, that your sins may be put away, when the time of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall send Jesus Christ, which before was preached unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whom the heaven must contain until the time that all things be restored, which God had spoken by the mouth of all his holy Prophets since the world began.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses said unto the Fathers, The Lord your God shall raise up unto you a Prophet, even of your brethren, like unto me: ye shall hear him in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it shall be that every person which shall not hear that Prophet, shall be destroyed out of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also all the Prophets from Samuel, and thenceforth as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold of these days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye are the children of the Prophets, and of the covenant, which God hath made unto our fathers, saying to Abraham, Even in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: First unto you hath God raised up his Son Jesus, and him he hath sent to bless you, in turning everyone of you from your iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they spake unto the people, the Priests and the Captain of the Temple, and the Sadducees came upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Taking it grievously that they taught the people, and preached in Jesus’ Name the resurrection from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they laid hands on them, and put them in hold, until the next day, for it was now eventide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit many of them which heard the word, believed, and the number of the men was about five thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers, and Elders, and Scribes, were gathered together at Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Annas the chief Priest, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and as many as were of the kindred of the high Priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had set them before them, they asked, By what power, or in what Name have ye done this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter full of the holy Ghost, said unto them, Ye rulers of the people, and Elders of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as much as we this day are examined, of the good deed done to the impotent man, to wit, by what means he is made whole,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be it known unto you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the Name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom ye have crucified, whom God raised again from the dead, even by him doth this man stand here before you, whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the stone cast aside of you builders, which is become the head of the corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither is there salvation in any other: for among men there is given none other Name under heaven, whereby we must be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and understood that they were unlearned men and without knowledge, they marveled, and knew them, that they had been with Jesus:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And beholding also the man which was healed standing with them, they had nothing to say against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they commanded them to go aside out of the Council, and conferred among themselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, What shall we do to these men? for surely a manifest sign is done by them, and it is openly known to all them that dwell in Jerusalem: and we cannot deny it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that it be noised no farther among the people, let us threaten and charge them, that they speak henceforth to no man in this Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they called them, and commanded them, that in no wise they should speak or teach in the Name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter and John answered unto them, and said, Whether it be right in the sight of God, to obey you rather than God, judge ye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they threatened them, and let them go, and found nothing how to punish them, because of the people: for all men praised God for that which was done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the man was above forty years old, on whom this miracle of healing was showed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then as soon as they were let go, they came to their fellows, and showed all that the high Priests and Elders had said unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard it, they lifted up their voices to God with one accord, and said, O Lord, thou art the God which had made the heaven, and the earth, the sea, and all things that are in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which by the mouth of thy servant David hast said, Why did the Gentiles rage, and the people imagine vain things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The kings of the earth assembled, and the rulers came together against the Lord, and against his Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For doubtless, against thine holy Son Jesus, whom thou hadst anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel gathered themselves together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To do whatsoever thine hand, and thy counsel had determined before to be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, O Lord, behold their threatenings, and grant unto thy servants with all boldness to speak thy word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that thou stretch forth thine hand that healing, and signs, and wonders may be done by the Name of thine holy Son Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when as they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were assembled together, and they were all filled with the holy Ghost, and they spake the word of God boldly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitude of them that believed, were of one heart, and of one soul: neither any of them said, that anything of that which he possessed, was his own, but they had all things common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with great power gave the Apostles witness of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus: and great grace was upon them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither was there any among them, that lacked: for as many as were possessors of lands or houses, sold them, and brought the price of the things that were sold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And laid it down at the Apostles’ feet, and it was distributed unto every man, according as he had need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Joses which was called of the Apostles, Barnabas (that is by interpretation, the son of consolation) being a Levite, and of the country of Cyprus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where as he had land, sold it, and brought the money, and laid it down at the Apostles’ feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And kept away part of the price, his wife also being of counsel, and brought a certain part, and laid it down at the Apostles’ feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Peter, Ananias, why hath Satan filled thine heart, that thou shouldest lie unto the holy Ghost, and keep away part of the price of this possession?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While it remained, appertained it not unto thee? and after it was sold, was it not in thine own power? how is it that thou hast conceived this thing in thine heart? thou hast not lied unto men, but unto God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Ananias heard these words, he fell down, and gave up the ghost. Then great fear came on all them that heard these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the young men rose up, and took him up, and carried him out, and buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass about the space of three hours after, that his wife came in, ignorant of that which was done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said unto her, Tell me, sold ye the land for so much? And she said, Yea, for so much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said unto her, Why have ye agreed together, to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? behold, the feet of them which have buried thine husband, are at the door, and shall carry thee out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she fell down straightway at his feet, and yielded up the ghost: and the young men came in, and found her dead, and carried her out, and buried her by her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great fear came on all the Church, and on as many as heard these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus by the hands of the Apostles were many signs and wonders showed among the people (and they were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the other durst no man join himself to them: nevertheless the people magnified them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the number of them that believed in the Lord, both of men and women, grew more and more)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Insomuch that they brought the sick into the streets, and laid them on beds and couches, that at the leastway the shadow of Peter, when he came by, might shadow some of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There came also a multitude out of the cities round about unto Jerusalem, bringing sick folks, and them which were vexed with unclean spirits, who were all healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief Priest rose up, and all they that were with him (which was the sect of the Sadducees) and were full of indignation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And laid hands on the Apostles, and put them in the common prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them forth, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go your way, and stand in the Temple, and speak to the people, all the words of this life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they heard it, they entered into the Temple early in the morning, and taught. And the chief Priest came, and they that were with him, and called the Council together, and all the Elders of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison, to cause them to be brought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the officers came, and found them not in the prison, they returned and told it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Certainly we found the prison shut as sure as was possible, and the keepers standing without, before the doors: but when we had opened, we found no man within.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when the chief Priest and the captain of the Temple, and the high Priests heard these things, they doubted of them, whereunto this would grow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came one and showed them, saying, Behold, the men that ye put in prison, are standing in the Temple, and teach the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then went the captain with the officers, and brought them without violence (for they feared the people, lest they should have been stoned.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had brought them, they set them before the Council, and the chief Priest asked them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Did we not straightly command you, that ye should not teach in this name? and behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and ye would bring this man’s blood upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter and the Apostles answered, and said, We ought rather to obey God than men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of our fathers hath raised up Jesus whom ye slew, and hanged on a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Him hath God lifted up with his right hand, to be a Prince and a Savior, to give repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we are his witnesses concerning these things which we say: yea, and the holy Ghost, whom God hath given to them that obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard it, they brast for anger, and consulted to slay them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then stood there up in the Council a certain Pharisee named Gamaliel, a doctor of the Law, honored of all the people, and commanded to put the Apostles forth a little space,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto them, Men of Israel, take heed to yourselves, what ye intend to do touching these men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For before these times, rose up Theudas boasting himself, to whom resorted a number of men, about a four hundred, who was slain: and they all which obeyed him were scattered, and brought to naught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this man, arose up Judas of Galilee, in the days of the tribute, and drew away much people after him: he also perished, and all that obeyed him, were scattered abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I say unto you, Refrain yourselves from these men, and let them alone: for if this counsel, or this work be of men, it will come to naught:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it be of God, ye cannot destroy it, lest ye be found even fighters against God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to him they agreed, and called the Apostles: and when they had beaten them, they commanded that they should not speak in the Name of Jesus, and let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they departed from the Council, rejoicing, that they were counted worthy to suffer rebuke for his Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And daily in the Temple, and from house to house they ceased not to teach, and preach Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in those days, as the number of the disciples grew, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians towards the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciples together, and said, It is not meet that we should leave the word of God to serve the tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore brethren, look you out among you seven men of honest report, and full of the holy Ghost, and of wisdom, which we may appoint to this business.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we will give ourselves continually to prayer, and to the ministration of the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen a man full of faith and of the holy Ghost, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a Proselyte of Antioch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which they set before the Apostles: and they prayed, and laid their hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of God increased, and the number of the disciples was multiplied in Jerusalem greatly, and a great company of the Priests were obedient to the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Stephen full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there arose certain of the Synagogue, which are called Libertines, and Cyrenians, and of Alexandria, and of them of Cilicia, and of Asia, and disputed with Stephen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were not able to resist the wisdom, and the Spirit by the which he spake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they suborned men, which said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses, and God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus they moved the people and the Elders, and the Scribes: and running upon him, caught him, and brought him to the Council,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And set forth false witnesses, which said, This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place, and the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have heard him say, that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place, and shall change the ordinances which Moses gave us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as all that sat in the Council looked steadfastly on him, they saw his face as it had been the face of an Angel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the chief Priest, Are these things so?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Ye men, brethren, and Fathers, hearken, That God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham, while he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Haran,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto him, Come out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall show thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came he out of the land of the Chaldeans, and dwelt in Haran. And after that his father was dead, God brought him from thence into this land, wherein ye now dwell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gave him none inheritance in it, no not the breadth of a foot: yet he promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when as yet he had no child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God spake thus, that his seed should be a sojourner in a strange land: and that they should keep it in bondage, and entreat it evil four hundred years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the nation to whom they shall be in bondage, will I judge, saith God: and after that, they shall come forth and serve me in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave him also the covenant of circumcision: and to Abraham begatIsaac, and circumcised him the eighth day: and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jacob the twelve Patriarchs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Patriarchs moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt: but God was with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favor and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt, who made him governor over Egypt, and over his whole house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came there a famine over all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction, that our fathers found no sustenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt, he sent our fathers first:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the second time Joseph was known of his brethren, and Joseph’s kindred was made known unto Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then sent Joseph and caused his father to be brought, and all his kindred, even threescore and fifteen souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob went down into Egypt, and he died, and our fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And were removed into Shechem, and were put in the sepulcher, that Abraham had bought for money of the sons of Hamor, son of Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the time of the promise drew near, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Till another King arose, which knew not Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same dealt subtly with our kindred, and evil entreated our fathers, and made them to cast out their young children, that they should not remain alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same time was Moses born and was acceptable unto God: which was nourished up in his father’s house three months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was cast out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up, and nourished him for her own son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was mighty in words and in deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he was full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren, the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw one of them suffer wrong, he defended him, and avenged his quarrel that had the harm done to him, and smote the Egyptian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he supposed his brethren would have understood, that God by his hand should give them deliverance: but they understood it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next day, he showed himself unto them as they strove, and would have set them at one again, saying, Sirs, ye are brethren: why do ye wrong one to another?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that did his neighbor wrong, thrust him away, saying, Who made thee a prince, and a judge over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou kill me, as thou didst the Egyptian yesterday?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then fled Moses at that saying, and was a stranger in the land of Midian, where he begat two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when forty years were expired, there appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sinai, an Angel of the Lord in a flame of fire, in a bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight: and as he drew near to consider it, the voice of the Lord came unto him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. Then Moses trembled, and durst not behold it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to him, Put off thy shoes from thy feet: for the place where thou standest, is holy ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have seen, I have seen the affliction of my people, which is in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning, and am come down to deliver them: and now come, and I will send thee into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Moses whom they forsook, saying, Who made thee a prince and a judge? the same God sent for a prince, and a deliverer by the hand of the Angel which appeared to him in the bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought them out, doing wonders, and miracles in the land of Egypt, and in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is that Moses, which said unto the children of Israel, A Prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you, even of your brethren, like unto me: him shall ye hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is he that was in the Congregation, in the wilderness with the Angel, which spake to him in mount Sinai, and with our fathers, who received the lively oracles to give unto us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom our fathers would not obey, but refused, and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying unto Aaron, Make us gods that may go before us: for we know not what is become of this Moses that brought us out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made a calf in those days, and offered sacrifice unto the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God turned himself away, and gave them up to serve the host of heaven, as it is written in the book of the Prophets, O house of Israel, have ye offered to me slain beasts and sacrifices by the space of forty years in the wilderness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye took up the Tabernacle of Moloch, and the star of your god Remphan, figures, which ye made to worship them: therefore I will carry you away beyond Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers had the Tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, as he had appointed, speaking unto Moses, that he should make it according to the fashion that he had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which tabernacle also our fathers received, and brought in with Jesus into the possession of the Gentiles, which God drove out before our fathers, unto the days of David:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who found favor before God, and desired that he might find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Solomon built him an house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit the most High dwelleth not in temples made with hands, as saith the Prophet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven is my throne, and earth is my footstool: what house will ye build for me, saith the Lord? or what place is it that I should rest in?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hath not mine hand made all these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye stiff-necked and of uncircumcised hearts and ears, ye have always resisted the holy Ghost: as your fathers did, so do you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of the Prophets have not your fathers persecuted? and they have slain them, which showed before of the coming of that Just, of whom ye are now the betrayers and murderers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which have received the law by the ordinance of Angels, and have not kept it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they heard these things, their hearts brast for anger, and they gnashed at him with their teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he being full of the holy Ghost, looked steadfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, Behold, I see the heavens open, and the Son of man standing at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they gave a shout with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and ran upon him violently all at once,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And cast him out of the city, and stoned him: and the witnesses laid down their clothes at a young man’s feet, named Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they stoned Stephen, who called on God, and said, Lord Jesus receive my spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this sin to their charge. And when he had thus spoken, he slept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul consented to his death. And at that time, there was a great persecution against the Church which was at Jerusalem, and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judea and of Samaria, except the Apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then certain men fearing God, carried Stephen among them, to be buried, and made great lamentation for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul made havoc of the Church, and entered into every house, and drew out both men and women, and put them into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they that were scattered abroad, went to and fro preaching the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came Philip into the city of Samaria, and preached Christ unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people gave heed unto those things which Philip spake, with one accord, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unclean spirits crying with a loud voice, came out of many that were possessed of them: and many taken with palsies, and that halted, were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was great joy in that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was before in the city, a certain man called Simon, which used witchcraft, and bewitched the people of Samaria, saying that he himself was some great man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom they gave heed from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is that great power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gave heed unto him, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as soon as they believed Philip, which preached the things that concerned the kingdom of God, and the Name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized both men and women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon himself believed also, and was baptized, and continued with Philip, and wondered, when he saw the signs and great miracles which were done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Apostles, which were at Jerusalem, heard say, that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For as yet he was fallen down on none of them, but they were baptized only in the Name of the Lord Jesus.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then laid they their hands on them, and they received the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Simon saw that through laying on of the Apostles’ hands the holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay the hands, he may receive the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Peter unto him, Thy money perish with thee, because thou thinkest that the gift of God may be obtained with money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast neither part nor fellowship in this business: for thine heart is not right in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray God, that if it be possible, the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I see that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and in the bond of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Simon, and said, Pray ye to the Lord for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken, come upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they, when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the Gospel in many towns of the Samaritans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Angel of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, Arise, and go toward the South unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza, which is waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he arose and went on: and behold, a certain Eunuch of Ethiopia, Candace the Queen of the Ethiopians’ chief Governor, who had the rule of all her treasure, and came to Jerusalem to worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he returned sitting in his chariot, he read Isaiah the Prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near and join thyself to yonder chariot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Philip ran thither, and heard him read the Prophet Isaiah, and said, But understandest thou what thou readest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, How can I, except I had a guide? And he desired Philip, that he would come up and sit with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the place of the Scripture which he read, was this, He was lead as a sheep to the slaughter: and like a lamb dumb before his shearer, so opened he not his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his humility his judgment hath been exalted: but who shall declare his generation? for his life is taken from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Eunuch answered Philip, and said, I pray thee, of whom speaketh the Prophet this? of himself, or of some other man?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Philip opened his mouth, and began at the same Scripture, and preached unto him Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they went on their way, they came unto a certain water, and the Eunuch said, See, here is water: what doth let me to be baptized?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Philip said unto him, If thou believest with all thine heart, thou mayest. Then he answered, and said, I believe that that Jesus Christ is that Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they went down both into the water, both Philip and the Eunuch, and he baptized him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip, that the Eunuch saw him no more: so he went on his way rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Philip was found at Azotus, and he walked to and fro preaching in all the cities, till he came to Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high Priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And desired of him letters to Damascus to the Synagogues, that if he found any that were of that way, (either men or women) he might bring them bound unto Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as he journeyed, it came to pass that as he was come near to Damascus, suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he fell to the earth, and heard a voice saying to him, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Who art thou, Lord? And the Lord said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest: it is hard for thee to kick against pricks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He then both trembling and astonied, said, Lord, what wilt thou that I do? And the Lord said unto him, Arise, and go into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou shalt do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men also which journeyed with him, stood amazed, hearing his voice, but seeing no man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul arose from the ground, and opened his eyes, but saw no man. Then led they him by the hand, and brought him into Damascus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where he was three days without sight, and neither ate nor drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a certain disciple at Damascus named Ananias, and to him said the Lord in a vision, Ananias. And he said, Behold, I am here Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said unto him, Arise, and go into the street which is called Straight, and seek in the house of Judas after one called Saul of Tarsus: for behold, he prayeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And he saw in a vision a man named Ananias coming in to him, and putting his hands on him, that he might receive his sight.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard by many of this man, how much evil he hath done to thy saints at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover here he hath authority of the high Priests, to bind all that call on thy Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said unto him, Go thy way: for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my Name before the Gentiles, and Kings, and the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will show him, how many things he must suffer for my Name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ananias went his way, and entered into that house, and put his hands on him, and saith, Brother Saul, the Lord hath sent me (even Jesus that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest) that thou mightest receive thy sight, and be filled with the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales, and suddenly he received sight, and arose, and was baptized,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And received meat, and was strengthened. So was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And straightway he preached Christ in the Synagogues, that he was that Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that all that heard him were amazed, and said, Is not this he, that made havoc of them which called on this Name in Jerusalem, and came hither for that intent, that he should bring them bound unto the high Priests?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul increased the more in strength, and confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus, confirming that this was that Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their laying await was known of Saul: now they watched the gates day and night, that they might kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples took him by night, and put him through the wall, and let him down by a rope in a basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Saul was come to Jerusalem, he assayed to join himself with the disciples: but they were all afraid of him, and believed not that he was a disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Barnabas took him, and brought him to the Apostles, and declared to them, how he had seen the Lord in the way, and that he had spoken unto him, and how he had spoken boldly at Damascus in the Name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was conversant with them at Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And spake boldly in the Name of the Lord Jesus, and spake and disputed against the Grecians: but they went about to slay him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the brethren knew it, they brought him to Caesarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then had the Churches rest through all Judea, and Galilee, and Samaria, and were edified, and walked in the fear of the Lord, and were multiplied by the comfort of the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as Peter walked throughout all quarters, he came also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there he found a certain man named Aeneas, which had kept his couch eight years, and was sick of the palsy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Peter unto him, Aeneas, Jesus Christ maketh thee whole: arise and truss thy couch together. And he arose immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all that dwelt at Lydda and Sharon, saw him, and turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was also at Joppa a certain woman, a disciple named Tabitha (which by interpretation is called Dorcas) she was full of good works and alms which she did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in those days, that she was sick and died: and when they had washed her, they laid her in an upper chamber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now forasmuch as Lydda was near to Joppa, and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent unto him two men, desiring that he would not delay to come unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter arose and came with them: and when he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber, where all the widows stood by him weeping, and showing the coats and garments, which Dorcas made, while she was with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter put them all forth, and kneeled down, and prayed, and turned him to the body, and said, Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, sat up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he gave her the hand and lifted her up, and called the Saints and widows, and restored her alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a Tanner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore there was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a captain of the band called the Italian band,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A devout man, and one that feared God with all his household, which gave much alms to the people, and prayed God continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw in a vision evidently (about the ninth hour of the day) an Angel of God coming in to him, and saying unto him, Cornelius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, Lord? and he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are come up into remembrance before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lodgeth with one Simon a Tanner, whose house is by the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Angel which spake unto Cornelius, was departed, he called two of his servants, and a soldier that feared God, one of them that waited on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And told them all things, and sent them to Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the morrow as they went on their journey, and drew near unto the city, Peter went up upon the house to pray, about the sixth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then waxed he an hungered, and would have eaten: but while they made something ready, he fell into a trance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saw heaven opened, and a certain vessel come down unto him, as it had been a great sheet, knit at the four corners, and was let down to the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherein were all manner of four footed beasts of the earth, and wild beasts and creeping things, and fowls of the heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came a voice to him, Arise, Peter: kill, and eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, Not so, Lord: for I have never eaten anything that is polluted, or unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the voice spake unto him again the second time, The things that God hath purified, pollute thou not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was so done thrice: and the vessel was drawn up again into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen, meant, behold, the men which were sent from Cornelius, had inquired for Simon’s house, and stood at the gate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And called, and asked, whether Simon, which was surnamed Peter, were lodged there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, and doubt nothing: For I have sent them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter went down to the men, which were sent unto him from Cornelius, and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: what is the cause wherefore ye are come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, Cornelius the captain, a just man, and one that feareth God, and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from heaven by an holy Angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear thy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then called he them in, and lodged them: and the next day, Peter went forth with them, and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the day after, they entered into Caesarea. Now Cornelius waited for them, and had called together his kinsmen, and special friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass as Peter came in, that Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter took him up, saying, Stand up: for even I myself am a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he talked with him, he came in, and found many that were come together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Ye know that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew, to company, or come unto one of another nation: but God hath showed me, that I should not call any man polluted, or unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore came I unto you without saying nay, when I was sent for. I ask therefore, for what intent have ye sent for me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Cornelius said, Four days ago, about this hour, I fasted, and at the ninth hour I prayed in mine house, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send therefore to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter (he is lodged in the house of Simon a Tanner by the Seaside) who when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then sent I for thee immediately, and thou hast well done to come. Now therefore are we all here present before God to hear all things that are commanded thee of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter opened his mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive, that God is no [respecter] of persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye know the word which God hath sent to the children of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ, which is Lord of all:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the word which came through all Judea, beginning in Galilee, after the Baptism which John preached:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To wit, how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the holy Ghost, and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil: for God was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, and in Jerusalem, whom they slew, hanging him on a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Him God raised up the third day, and caused that he was showed openly:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not to all the people, but unto the witnesses chosen before of God, even to us which did eat and drink with him, after he arose from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify, that it is he that is ordained of God a judge of quick and dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To him also give all the Prophets witness, that through his Name all that believe in him, shall receive remission of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter yet spake these words, the holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they of the circumcision, which believed, were astonied, as many as came with Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God. Then answered Peter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the holy Ghost, as well as we?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he commanded them to be baptized in the Name of the Lord. Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Apostles and the brethren that were in Judea, heard, that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they of the circumcision contended against him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Thou wentest into men uncircumcised, and hast eaten with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter began, and expounded the thing in order to them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was in the city of Joppa, praying, and in a trance I saw this vision, A certain vessel coming down as it had been a great sheet, let down from heaven by the four corners, and it came to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Toward the which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw four footed beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also I heard a voice, saying unto me, Arise, Peter: slay and eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, God forbid, Lord: for nothing polluted or unclean hath at anytime entered into my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the voice answered me the second time from heaven, The things that God hath purified, pollute thou not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this was done three times, and all were taken up again into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then behold, immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was, sent from Caesarea unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Spirit said unto me, that I should go with them, without doubting: moreover these six brethren came with me, and we entered into the man’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he showed us, how he had seen an Angel in his house, which stood and said to him, Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall speak words unto thee, whereby both thou and all thine house shall be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as I began to speak, the holy Ghost fell on them, even as upon us at the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I remembered the word of the Lord, how he said, John baptized with water, but ye shall be baptized with the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as much then as God gave them a like gift, as he did unto us, when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I, that I could let God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then hath God also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they which were scattered abroad because of the affliction that arose about Stephen, went throughout till they came unto Phonicia and Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to no man, but unto the Jews only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some of them were men of Cyprus and of Cyrene, which when they were come into Antioch, spake unto the Grecians, and preached the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hand of the Lord was with them, so that a great number believed and turned unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then tidings of those things came unto the ears of the Church, which was in Jerusalem, and they sent forth Barnabas, that he should go unto Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who when he was come and had seen the grace of God, was glad, and exhorted all, that with purpose of heart they would continue in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was a good man, and full of the holy Ghost, and faith and much people joined themselves unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus to seek Paul:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch: and it came to pass that a whole year they were conversant with the Church, and taught much people, insomuch that the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days also came Prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there stood up one of them named Agabus, and signified by the Spirit, that there should be great famine throughout all the world, which also came to pass under Claudius Caesar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples every man according to his ability, purposed to send succor unto the brethren which dwelt in Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which thing they also did, and sent it to the Elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about that time, Herod the king stretched forth his hand to vex certain of the Church,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further, to take Peter also (then were the days of unleavened bread.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had caught him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to be kept, intending after the Passover to bring him forth to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter was kept in prison, but earnest prayer was made of the Church unto God for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Herod would have brought him out unto the people, the same night slept Peter between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and the keepers before the door, kept the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold the Angel of the Lord came upon them, and a light shined in the house, and he smote Peter on the side, and raised him up, saying, Arise quickly. And his chains fell off from his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals. And so he did. Then he said unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter came out and followed him, and knew not that it was true, which was done by the Angel, but thought he had seen a vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they were past the first and the second watch, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city, which opened to them by its own accord, and they went out, and passed through one street, and by and by the Angel departed from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know for a truth, that the Lord hath sent his Angel, and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and from all the waiting for of the people of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he considered the thing, he came to the house of Mary, the mother of John, whose surname was Mark, where many were gathered together, and prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Peter knocked at the entry door, a maid came forth to hearken, named Rhoda,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when she knew Peter’s voice, she opened not the entry door for gladness, but ran in, and told how Peter stood before the entry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said unto her, Thou art mad. Yet she affirmed it constantly, that it was so. Then said they, It is his Angel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter continued knocking, and when they had opened it, and saw him, they were astonied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he beckoned unto them with the hand, to hold their peace, and told them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, Go show these things unto James and to the brethren: and he departed and went into another place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small trouble among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Herod had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the keepers, and commanded them to be led to be punished. And he went down from Judea to Caesarea, and there abode.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod was angry with them of Tyre and Sidon, but they came all with one accord unto him, and persuaded Blastus the King’s Chamberlain, and they desired peace, because their country was nourished by the King’s land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And upon a day appointed, Herod arrayed himself in royal apparel, and sat on the judgment seat, and made an oration unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people gave a shout, saying, The voice of God, and not of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But immediately the Angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not glory unto God, so that he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of God grew, and multiplied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their office, and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were also in the Church that was at Antioch, certain Prophets and teachers, as Barnabas, and Simeon called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen (which had been brought up with Herod the Tetrarch) and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they ministered to the Lord, and fasted, the holy Ghost said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul, for the work whereunto I have called them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then fasted they and prayed, and laid their hands on them, and let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they after they were sent forth of the holy Ghost, came down unto Seleucia, and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the Synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John to their minister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had gone throughout the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, being a Jew, named Bar-Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which was with the Deputy Sergius Paulus, a prudent man. He called unto him Barnabas and Saul, and desired to hear the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Elymas the sorcerer, (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, and sought to turn away the Deputy from the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Saul (which also is called Paul) being full of the holy Ghost, set his eyes on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, O full of all subtlety and all mischief, the child of the devil, and enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the straight ways of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, and not see the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness, and he went about, seeking some to lead him by the hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Deputy when he saw what was done, believed, and was astonied at the doctrine of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Paul and they that were with him were departed by ship from Paphos, they came to Perga a city of Pamphylia: then John departed from them, and returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch a city of Pisidia, and went into the Synagogue on the Sabbath day, and sat down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the lecture of the Law and Prophets, the rulers of the Synagogue sent unto them, saying, Ye men and brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul stood up and beckoned with the hand, and said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, hearken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt in the land of Egypt, and with an high arm brought them out thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about the time of forty years, suffered he their manners in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, and divided their land to them by lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then afterward he gave unto them Judges about four hundred and fifty years, unto the time of Samuel the Prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after that, they desired a King, and God gave unto them Saul, the son of Cis, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, by the space of forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had taken him away, he raised up David to be their King, of whom he witnessed, saying, I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after mine own heart, which will do all things that I will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of this man’s seed hath God according to his promise raised up to Israel, the Savior Jesus:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when John had fulfilled his course, he said, Whom ye think that I am, I am not he: but behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoe of his feet I am not worthy to loose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye men and brethren, children of the generation of Abraham, and whosoever among you feareth God, to you is the word of this salvation sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor yet the words of the Prophets, which are read every Sabbath day, they have fulfilled them in condemning him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And though they found no cause of death in him, yet desired they Pilate to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had fulfilled all things that were written of him, they took him down from the tree, and put him in a sepulcher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God raised him up from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was seen many days of them, which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, which are his witnesses unto the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we declare unto you, that touching the promise made unto the fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God hath fulfilled it unto us their children, in that he raised up Jesus, even as it is written in the second Psalm, Thou art my Son: this day have I begotten thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, no more to return to corruption, he hath said thus, I will give you the holy things of David, which are faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore he saith also in another place, Thou wilt not suffer thine holy one to see corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit, David after he had served his time by the counsel of God, he slept, and was laid with his fathers, and saw corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he whom God raised up, saw no corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be it known unto you therefore, men and brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the Law of Moses, by him everyone that believeth, is justified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware therefore lest that come upon you, which is spoken of in the Prophets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and vanish away: for I work a work in your days, a work which ye shall not believe, if a man would declare it you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were come out of the Synagogue of the Jews, the Gentiles besought, that they would preach these words to them the next Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the congregation was dissolved, many of the Jews and Proselytes that feared God, followed Paul and Barnabas, which spake unto them, and exhorted them to continue in the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next Sabbath day came almost the whole city together, to hear the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
