verses.text: But when the Jews saw the people, they were full of envy, and spake against those things, which were spoken of Paul, contrarying them, and railing on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul and Barnabas spake boldly, and said, It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken unto you: but seeing ye put it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For so hath the Lord commanded us, saying, I have made thee a light of the Gentiles, that thou shouldest be the salvation unto the end of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Gentiles heard it, they were glad, and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained unto eternal life, believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the word of the Lord was published throughout the whole country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews stirred certain devout and honorable women, and the chief men of the city, and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them out of their coasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples were filled with joy, and with the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in Iconium, that they went both together into the Synagogue of the Jews, and so spake, that a great multitude both of the Jews and of the Grecians believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the unbelieving Jews stirred up, and corrupted the minds of the Gentiles against the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So therefore they abode there a long time, and spake boldly in the Lord, which gave testimony unto the word of his grace, and caused signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the multitude of the city was divided: and some were with the Jews, and some with the Apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles, and of the Jews with their rulers, to do them violence, and to stone them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were ware of it, and fled unto Lystra, and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and unto the region round about,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there preached the Gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there sat a certain man at Lystra, impotent in his feet, which was a cripple from his mother’s womb, who had never walked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He heard Paul speak: who beholding him and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped up, and walked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when the people saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, Gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called Barnabas, Jupiter: and Paul Mercurius, because he was the chief speaker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jupiter’s Priest, which was before their city, brought bulls with garlands unto the gates, and would have sacrificed with the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Apostles, Barnabas and Paul heard it, they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And saying, O men, why do ye these things? We are even men subject to the like passions that ye be, and preach unto you, that ye should turn from these vain things unto the living God, which made heaven and earth, and the sea, and all things that in them are:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who in times past suffered all the Gentiles to walk in their own ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, he left not himself without witness, in that he did good and gave us rain from heaven, and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food, and gladness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And speaking these things, scarce appeased they the multitude, that they had not sacrificed unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there came certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium, which when they had persuaded the people, stoned Paul, and drew him out of the city, supposing he had been dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit, as the disciples stood round about him, he arose up, and came into the city, and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had preached the glad tidings of the Gospel to that city, and had taught many, they returned to Lystra, and to Iconium, and to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Confirming the disciples hearts, and exhorting them to continue in the faith, affirming that we must through many afflictions enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had ordained them Elders by election in every Church, and prayed, and fasted, they commended them to the Lord in whom they believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus they went throughout Pisidia, and came to Pamphylia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had preached the word in Perga, they came down to Attalia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thence sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been commended unto the grace of God, to the work, which they had fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were come and had gathered the Church together, they rehearsed all the things that God had done by them, and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there they abode a long time with the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came down certain from Judea, and taught the brethren, saying, Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses, ye cannot be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when there was great dissension, and disputation by Paul and Barnabas against them, they ordained that Paul and Barnabas, and certain others of them, should go up to Jerusalem unto the Apostles and Elders about this question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus being brought forth by the Church, they passed through Phoenicia and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles, and they brought great joy unto all the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received of the Church, and of the Apostles and Elders, and they declared what things God had done by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But said they, certain of the sect of the Pharisees, which did believe, rose up, saying that it was needful to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the Law of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Apostles and Elders came together to look to this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when there had been great disputation, Peter rose up, and said unto them, Ye men and brethren, ye know that a good while ago, among us God chose out me, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the Gospel, and believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, in giving unto them the holy Ghost even as he did unto us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put no difference between us and them, after that by faith he had purified their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, why tempt ye God, to lay a yoke on the disciples’ necks, which neither our fathers, nor we were able to bear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we believe, through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ to be saved, even as they do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the multitude kept silence, and heard Barnabas and Paul, which told what signs and wonders God had done among the Gentiles by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they held their peace, James answered, saying, Men and brethren, hearken unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon hath declared, how God first did visit the Gentiles, to take of them a people unto his Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to this agree the words of the Prophets, as it is written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this I will return, and will build again the Tabernacle of David, which is fallen down, and the ruins thereof will I build again, and I will set it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord, and all the Gentiles upon whom my Name is called, saith the Lord which doeth all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the beginning of the world, God knoweth all his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore my sentence is, that we trouble not them of the Gentiles that are turned to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that we send unto them, that they abstain themselves from filthiness of idols, and fornication, and that is strangled, and from blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him, seeing he is read in the Synagogues every Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it seemed good to the Apostles and Elders with the whole Church to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas: to wit, Judas whose surname was Barsabas, and Silas, which were chief men among the brethren,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And wrote letters by them after this manner, THE APOSTLES, and the Elders, and the brethren, Unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch, and in Syria, and in Cilicia, send greeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forasmuch as we have heard, that certain which went out from us, have troubled you with words, and cumbered your minds, saying, Ye must be circumcised and keep the Law: to whom we gave no such commandment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It seemed therefore good to us, when we were come together with one accord, to [send] chosen men unto you, with our beloved Barnabas and Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men that have given up their lives for the Name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have therefore sent Judas and Silas, which shall also tell you the same things by mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it seemed good to the holy Ghost, and to us, to lay no more burden upon you, than these necessary things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is, that ye abstain from things offered to idols, and blood, and that that is strangled, and from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well. Fare ye well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they were departed, they came to Antioch, and after that they had assembled the multitude, they delivered the Epistle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had read it, they rejoiced for the consolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judas and Silas being Prophets, exhorted the brethren with many words, and strengthened them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had tarried there a space, they were let go in peace of the brethren unto the Apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding Silas thought good to abide there still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and preaching with many others the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after certain days, Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us return and visit our brethren in every city, where we have preached the word of the Lord, and see how they do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Barnabas counseled to take with them John, called Mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul thought it not meet to take him unto their company, which departed from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then were they so stirred, that they departed asunder one from the other, so that Barnabas took Mark, and sailed unto Cyprus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul chose Silas and departed, being commended of the brethren unto the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, establishing the Churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came he to Derbe and to Lystra: and behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timothy, a woman’s son, which was a Jewess and believed, but his father was a Grecian,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of whom the brethren which were at Lystra and Iconium, reported well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Paul would that he should go forth with him, and took and circumcised him, because of the Jews, which were in those quarters: for they knew all that his father was a Grecian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they went through the cities, they delivered them the decrees to keep, ordained of the Apostles and Elders which were at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so were the Churches established in the faith, [and] increased in number daily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia, and the region of Galatia, they were forbidden of the holy Ghost, to preach the word in Asia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came they to Mysia, and sought to go into Bithynia: but the Spirit suffered them not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they passed through Mysia, and came down to Troas,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where a vision appeared to Paul in the night. There stood a man of Macedonia, and prayed him, saying, Come into Macedonia, and help us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had seen the vision, immediately we prepared to go into Macedonia, being assured that the Lord had called us to preach the Gospel unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then went we forth from Troas, and with a straight course came to Samothrace, and the next day to Neapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from thence to Philippi, which is the chief city in the parts of Macedonia, and whose inhabitants came from Rome to dwell there: and we were in that city abiding certain days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the Sabbath day we went out of the city, besides a river, where they were wont to pray: and we sat down, and spake unto the women, which were come together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of the Thyatirians, which worshipped God, heard us: whose heart the Lord opened, that she attended unto the things, which Paul spake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she was baptized, and her household, she besought us, saying, If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into mine house, and abide there: and she constrained us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass that as we went to prayer, a certain maid having a spirit of divination, met us, which gat her masters much vantage with divining.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She followed Paul and us, and cried, saying, These men are the servants of the most high God, which show unto you the way of salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this did she many days: but Paul being grieved, turned about, and said to the spirit, I command thee in the Name of Jesus Christ, that thou come out of her. And he came out the same hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when her masters saw that the hope of their gain was gone, they caught Paul and Silas, and drew them into the marketplace unto the Magistrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And brought them to the governors, saying, These men which are Jews trouble our city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And preach ordinances, which are not lawful for us to receive, neither to observe, seeing we are Romans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people also rose up together against them, and the governors rent their clothes, and commanded them to be beaten with rods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had beaten them sore, they cast them into prison, commanding the Gaoler to keep them surely,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who having received such commandment, cast them into the inner prison, and made their feet fast in the stocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at midnight Paul and Silas prayed, and sung Psalms unto God: and the prisoners heard them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundation of the prison was shaken: and by and by all the doors opened, and every man’s bands were loosed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the keeper of the prison waked out of his sleep, and when he saw the prison doors open, he drew out his sword and would have killed himself, supposing the prisoners had been fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm: for we all are here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called for a light, and leaped in, and came trembling, and fell down before Paul and Silas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, Believe in the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thine household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they preached unto him the word of the Lord, and to all that were in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward he took them the same hour of the night, and washed their stripes, and was baptized with all that belonged unto him straightway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had brought them into his house, he set meat before them, and rejoiced that he with all his household believed in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was day, the governors sent the sergeants, saying, Let those men go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the keeper of the prison told these words unto Paul, saying, The governors have sent to loose you: now therefore get you hence, and go in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Paul unto them, After that they have beaten us openly uncondemned, which are Romans, they have cast us into prison, and now would they put us out privily? nay verily: but let them come and bring us out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sergeants told these words unto the governors, who feared when they heard that they were Romans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came they and prayed them, and brought them out, and desired them to depart out of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went out of the prison, and entered into the house of Lydia: and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them, and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they passed through Amphipolis, and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a Synagogue of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul, as his manner was, went in unto them, and three Sabbath days disputed with them by the Scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Opening, and alleging that Christ must have suffered, and risen again from the dead, and this is Jesus Christ, whom said he, I preach to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of them believed, and joined in company with Paul and Silas: also of the Grecians that feared God a great multitude, and of the chief women not a few.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews which believed not, moved with envy, took unto them certain vagabonds and wicked fellows, and when they had assembled the multitude, they made a tumult in the city, and made assault against the house of Jason, and sought to bring them out to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they found them not, they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the heads of the city, crying, These are they which have subverted the state of the world, and here they are,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whom Jason hath received, and these all do against the decrees of Caesar, saying, that there is another King one Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they troubled the people, and the heads of the city, when they heard these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding when they had received sufficient assurance of Jason and of the others, they let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea, which when they were come thither, entered into the Synagogue of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were also more noble men than they which were at Thessalonica, which received the word with all readiness, and searched the Scriptures daily, whether those things were so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore many of them believed, and of honest women, which were Grecians, and men not a few.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica knew, that the word of God was also preached of Paul at Berea, they came thither also, and moved the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But by and by the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea: but Silas and Timothy abode there still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that did conduct Paul, brought him unto Athens: and when they had received a commandment unto Silas and Timothy that they should come to him at once, they departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred in him, when he saw the city subject to idolatry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he disputeth in the Synagogue with the Jews, and with them that were religious, and in the market daily with whomsoever he met.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then certain Philosophers of the Epicureans, and of the Stoics, disputed with him, and some said, What will this babbler say? Others said, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods (because he preached unto them Jesus, and the resurrection.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took him, and brought him into Mars’ street, saying, May we not know, what this new doctrine, whereof thou speakest, is?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou bringest certain strange things unto our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the Athenians and strangers which dwelt there, gave themselves to nothing else, but either to tell, or to hear some news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars’ street, and said, Ye men of Athens, I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as I passed by, and beheld your devotions, I found an altar wherein was written, UNTO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Whom ye then ignorantly worship, him show I unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God that made the world, and all things that are therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither is worshipped with men’s hands, as though he needed anything, seeing he giveth to all life and breath and all things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And hath made of one blood all mankind, to dwell on all the face of the earth, and hath assigned the seasons which were ordained before, and the bounds of their habitation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That they should seek the Lord, if so be they might have groped after him, and found him, though doubtless he be not far from every one of us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in him we live, and move, and have our being, as also certain of your own Poets have said: For we are also his generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forasmuch then, as we are the generation of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone graven by art and the invention of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the time of this ignorance God regarded not: but now he admonisheth all men everywhere to repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he hath appointed a day in the which he will judge the world in righteousness, by that man whom he hath appointed, whereof he hath given an assurance to all men, in that he hath raised him from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they had heard of the resurrection from the dead, some mocked, and others said, We will hear thee again of this thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so Paul departed from among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit certain men clave unto Paul, and believed: among whom was also Dionysius Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things, Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus, lately come from Italy, and his wife Priscilla (because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome) and he came unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them and wrought (for their craft was to make tents.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he disputed in the Synagogue every Sabbath day, and exhorted the Jews, and the Grecians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Silas and Timothy were come from Macedonia, Paul, forced in spirit, testified to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they resisted and blasphemed, he shook his raiment, and said unto them, Your blood be upon your own head: I am clean: from henceforth will I go unto the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he departed thence, and entered into a certain man’s house, named Justus, a worshipper of God, whose house joined hard to the Synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Crispus the chief ruler of the Synagogue, believed in the Lord with all his household: and many of the Corinthians hearing it, believed and were baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision, Fear not, but speak, and hold not thy peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am with thee, and no man shall lay hands on thee to hurt thee: for I have much people in this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he continued there a year and six months, and taught the word of God among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Gallio was deputy of Achaia, the Jews arose with one accord against Paul, and brought him to the judgment seat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, This fellow persuadeth men to worship God otherwise than the Law appointeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, If it were a matter of wrong, or an evil deed, O ye Jews, I would according to reason maintain you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it be a question of words and names, and of your Law, look ye to it yourselves: for I will be no judge of those things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he drove them from the judgment seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then took all the Grecians Sosthenes the chief ruler of the Synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat: but Gallio cared nothing for those things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Paul had tarried there yet a good while, he took leave of the brethren, and sailed into Syria, (and with him Priscilla and Aquila) after that he had shorn his head in Cenchrea: for he had made a vow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came to Ephesus, and left them there: but he entered into the Synagogue and disputed with the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who desired him to tarry a longer time with them: but he would not consent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But bade them farewell, saying, I must needs keep this feast that cometh, in Jerusalem: but I will return again unto you, if God will. So he sailed from Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came down to Caesarea, he went up to Jerusalem: and when he had saluted the Church, he went down unto Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he had tarried there a while, he departed, and went through the country of Galatia and Phrygia by order, strengthening all the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain Jew named Apollos, born at Alexandria, came to Ephesus, an eloquent man, and mighty in the Scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same was instructed in the way of the Lord, and he spake fervently in the Spirit, and taught diligently the things of the Lord, and knew but the baptism of John only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to speak boldly in the Synagogue. Whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard, they took him unto them, and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was minded to go into Achaia, the brethren exhorting him, wrote to the disciples to receive him: and after he was come thither, he helped them much which had believed through grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For mightily he confuted publicly the Jews, with great vehemency, showing by the Scriptures, that Jesus was that Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, while Apollos was at Corinth, that Paul when he passed through the upper coasts, came to Ephesus, and found certain disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto them, Have ye received the holy Ghost since ye believed? And they said unto him, We have not so much as heard whether there be an holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Unto what were ye then baptized? And they said, Unto John’s baptism.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Paul, John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people, that they should believe in him, which should come after him, that is, in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard it, they were baptized in the Name of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Paul laid his hands upon them, and the holy Ghost came on them, and they spake the tongues, and prophesied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the men were about twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover he went into the Synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three months, disputing and exhorting to the things that appertain to the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when certain were hardened, and disobeyed, speaking evil of the way of God before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, and disputed daily in the school of one Tyrannus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this was done by the space of two years, so that all they which dwelt in Asia, heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Grecians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God wrought no small miracles by the hands of Paul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that from his body were brought unto the sick, kerchiefs, or handkerchiefs, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists took in hand to name over them which had evil spirits, the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, We adjure you by Jesus, whom Paul preacheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And there were certain sons of Sceva a Jew, the Priest, about seven which did this.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the evil spirit answered, and said, Jesus I acknowledge, and Paul I know: but who are ye?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was, ran on them, and overcame them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house, naked and wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this was known to all the Jews and Grecians also which dwelt at Ephesus, and fear came on them all, and the Name of the Lord Jesus was magnified,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many that believed, came and confessed, and showed their works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many also of them which used curious arts, brought their books, and burned them before all men: and they counted the price of them, and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the word of God grew mightily, and prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when these things were accomplished, Paul purposed by the Spirit to pass through Macedonia and Achaia, and to go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I must also see Rome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So sent he into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him, Timothy, and Erastus, but he remained in Asia for a season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the same time there arose no small trouble about that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a certain man named Demetrius a silversmith, which made silver temples of Diana, brought great gains unto the craftsmen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whom he called together, with the workmen of like things, and said, Sirs, ye know that by this craft we have our goods:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover ye see and hear, that not alone at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia this Paul hath persuaded, and turned away much people, saying, That they be not Gods which are made with hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that not only this thing is dangerous unto us, that this our portion shall be reproved, but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be nothing esteemed, and that it would come to pass that her magnificence, which all Asia and the world worshippeth, should be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard it, they were full of wrath, and cried out, saying, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole city was full of confusion, and they rushed into the common place with one assent, and caught Gaius, and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, and Paul’s companions of his journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certain also of the chief of Asia, which were his friends, sent unto him, desiring him that he would not present himself in the Common place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another: for the assembly was out of order, and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of the company drew forth Alexander, the Jews thrusting him forwards. Alexander then beckoned with the hand, and would have excused the matter to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they knew that he was a Jew, there arose a shout almost for the space of two hours, of all men, crying, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the town clerk when he had stayed the people, said, Ye men of Ephesus, what man is it that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana, and of the image, which came down from Jupiter?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing then that no man can speak against these things, ye ought to be appeased, and to do nothing rashly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye have brought hither these men, which have neither committed sacrilege, neither do blaspheme your goddess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore, if Demetrius and the craftsmen which are with him, have a matter against any man, the law is open, and there are Deputies: let them accuse one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye inquire anything concerning other matters, it may be determined in a lawful assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are even in jeopardy to be accused of this day’s sedition, forasmuch as there is no cause, whereby we may give a reason of this concourse of people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had thus spoken, he let the assembly depart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after the tumult was appeased, Paul called the disciples unto him, and embraced them, and departed to go into Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had gone through those parts, and had exhorted them with many words, he came into Greece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having tarried there three months, because the Jews laid wait for him, as he was about to sail into Syria, he purposed to return through Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there accompanied him into Asia, Sopater of Berea, and of them of Thessalonica, Aristarchus, and Secundus, and Gaius of Derbe, and Timothy, and of them of Asia, Tychicus, and Trophimus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These went before, and tarried us at Troas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we sailed forth from Philippi, after the days of unleavened bread, and came unto them to Troas in five days, where we abode seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the first day of the week, the disciples being come together to break bread, Paul preached unto them, ready to depart on the morrow, and continued the preaching unto midnight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were many lights in an upper chamber, where they were gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there sat in a window a certain young man, named Eutychus, fallen into a dead sleep: and as Paul was long preaching, he overcome with sleep, fell down from the third loft, and was taken up dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul went down, and laid himself upon him, and embraced him, saying, Trouble not yourselves: for his life is in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when Paul was come up again, and had broken bread, and eaten, having spoken a long while till the dawning of the day, he so departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought the boy alive, and they were not a little comforted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we went before to ship, and sailed unto the city Assos, that we might receive Paul there: for so had he appointed, and would himself go afoot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he was come unto us to Assos, and we had received him, we came to Mitylene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we sailed thence, and came the next day over against Chios, and the next day we arrived at Samos, and tarried at Trogyllium: the next day we came to Miletus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus, because he would not spend the time in Asia: for he hasted to be, if he could possible, at Jerusalem, at the day of Pentecost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore from Miletus, he sent to Ephesus, and called the Elders of the Church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye know from the first day that I came into Asia, after what manner I have been with you at all seasons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Serving the Lord with all modesty, and with many tears, and temptations, which came unto me by the layings await of the Jews,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable, but have showed you, and taught you openly and throughout every house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Witnessing both to the Jews, and to the Grecians the repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now behold, I go bound in the Spirit unto Jerusalem, and know not what things shall come unto me there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Save that the holy Ghost witnesseth in every city, saying, that bonds and afflictions abide me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I pass not at all, neither is my life dear unto myself, so that I may fulfill my course with joy, and the ministration which I have received of the Lord Jesus, to testify the Gospel of the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now behold, I know that henceforth ye all, through whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God, shall see my face no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore I take you to record this day, that I am pure from the blood of all men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have kept nothing back, but have showed you all the counsel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves, and to all the flock, whereof the holy Ghost hath made you Overseers to feed the Church of God which he hath purchased with that his own blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know this, that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover of your own selves shall men arise speaking perverse things, to draw disciples after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore watch, and remember, that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn everyone, both night and day with tears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now brethren, I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build further, and to give you an inheritance, among all them, which are sanctified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have coveted no man’s silver, nor gold, nor apparel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, ye know, that these hands have ministered unto my necessities, and to them that were with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have showed you all things, how that so laboring, ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how that he said, It is a blessed thing to give, rather than to receive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they wept all abundantly, and fell on Paul’s neck, and kissed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being chiefly sorry for the words which he spake, That they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him unto the ship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as we launched forth, and were departed from them, we came with a straight course unto Cos, and the day following unto the Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we found a ship that went over unto Phoenicia, and went aboard, and set forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had discovered Cyprus, we left it on the left hand, and sailed toward Syria, and arrived at Tyre: for there the ship unladed the burden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had found disciples, we tarried there seven days. And they told Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the days were ended, we departed and went our way, and they all accompanied us with their wives and children, even out of the city: and we kneeled down on the shore, prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when we had embraced one another, we took ship, and they returned home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had ended the course from Tyre, we arrived at Ptolemais, and saluted the brethren, and abode with them one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next day, Paul and we that were with him, departed, and came unto Caesarea: and we entered into the house of Philip the Evangelist, which was one of the seven Deacons, and abode with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as we tarried there many days, there came a certain Prophet from Judea, named Agabus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come unto us, he took Paul’s girdle, and bound his own hands and feet, and said, Thus saith the holy Ghost, So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle, and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had heard these things, both we and others of the same place besought him that he would not go up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul answered, and said, What do ye weeping and breaking mine heart? For I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at Jerusalem for the Name of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The will of the Lord be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after those days we trussed up our fardels, and went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea, and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus, an old disciple, with whom we should lodge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next day Paul went in with us unto James: and all the Elders were there assembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had embraced them, he told by order all things, that God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they heard it, they glorified God, and said unto him, Thou seest, brother, how many thousand Jews there are which believe, and they are all zealous of the Law:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they are informed of thee, that thou teachest all the Jews, which are among the Gentiles, to forsake Moses, and sayest that they ought not to circumcise their sons, neither to live after the customs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is then to be done? the multitude must needs come together: for they shall hear that thou art come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do therefore this that we say to thee. We have four men, which have made a vow,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Them take, and purify thyself with them, and contribute with them, that they may shave their heads: and all shall know, that those things, whereof they have been informed concerning thee, are nothing, but that thou thyself also walkest and keepest the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as touching the Gentiles, which believe, we have written, and determined that they observe no such thing, but that they keep themselves from things offered to idols, and from blood, and from that that is strangled, and from fornication.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul took the men, and the next day was purified with them, and entered into the Temple, declaring the accomplishment of the days of the purification, until that an offering should be offered for everyone of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews which were of Asia (when they saw him in the Temple) moved all the people, and laid hands on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Crying, Men of Israel, help: this is the man that teachest all men everywhere against the people, and the Law, and this place: moreover, he hath brought Grecians into the Temple, and hath polluted this holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they had seen before Trophimus an Ephesian with him in the city, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the city was moved, and the people ran together: and they took Paul, and drew him out of the Temple, and forthwith the doors were shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was on an uproar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who immediately took soldiers and Centurions, and ran down unto them: and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they left beating of Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief Captain came near and took him, and commanded him to be bound with two chains, and demanded who he was, and what he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one cried this, another that, among the people. So when he could not know the certainty for the tumult, he commanded him to be led into the castle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came unto the grieces, it was so that he was borne of the soldiers, for the violence of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the multitude of the people followed after, crying, Away with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Paul should have been led into the castle, he said unto the chief captain, May I speak unto thee? Who said, Canst thou speak Greek?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Art not thou the Egyptian who before these days raised a sedition, and led out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul said, Doubtless, I am a man which am a Jew, and citizen of Tarsus, a famous city of Cilicia, and I beseech thee, suffer me to speak unto the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had given him license, Paul stood on the grieces, and beckoned with the hand unto the people, and when there was made great silence, he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye men, brethren and fathers, hear my defense now towards you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them, they kept the more silence, and he said,)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am verily a man, which am a Jew, born in Tarsus in Cilicia, but brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, and instructed according to the perfect manner of the Law of the fathers, and was zealous toward God, as ye all are this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I persecuted this way unto the death, binding and delivering into prison both men and women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As also the chief Priest doth bear me witness, and all the company of the Elders: of whom also I received letters unto the brethren, and went to Damascus to bring them which were there, bound unto Jerusalem, that they might be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was, as I journeyed, and was come near unto Damascus about noon, that suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I fell unto the earth, and heard a voice, saying unto me, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I answered, Who art thou, Lord? And he said to me, I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom thou persecutest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover they that were with me, saw indeed a light and were afraid: but they heard not the voice of him that spake unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, What shall I do, Lord? And the Lord said unto me, Arise, and go into Damascus: and there it shall be told thee of all things, which are appointed for thee to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when I could not see for the glory of that light, I was led by the hand of them that were with me, and came into Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one Ananias a godly man, as pertaining to the Law, having good report of all the Jews which dwelt there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Came unto me, and stood, and said unto me, Brother Saul, receive thy sight: and that same hour I looked upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, The God of our fathers hath appointed thee, that thou shouldest know his will, and shouldest see that Just one, and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men, of the things which thou hast seen and heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore why tarriest thou? Arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, in calling on the Name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, that when I was come again to Jerusalem, and prayed in the Temple, I was in a trance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And saw him, saying unto me, Make haste, and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem: for they will not receive thy witness concerning me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, Lord, they know that I prisoned, and beat in every Synagogue them that believed in thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed, I also stood by, and consented unto his death, and kept the clothes of them that slew him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto me, Depart: for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they heard him unto this word, but then they lifted up their voices, and said, Away with such a fellow from the earth: for it is not meet that he should live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they cried and cast off their clothes, and threw dust into the air,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief captain commanded him to be led into the castle, and bade that he should be scourged, and examined, that he might know wherefore they cried so on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they bound him with thongs, Paul said unto the Centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge one that is a Roman, and not condemned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Centurion heard it, he went, and told the chief captain, saying, Take heed what thou doest: for this man is a Roman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief captain came, and said to him, Tell me, art thou a Roman? And he said, Yea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief captain answered, With a great sum obtained I this freedom. Then Paul said, But I was so born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then straightway they departed from him, which should have examined him: and the chief captain also was afraid, after he knew that he was a Roman, and that he had bound him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews, he loosed him from his bonds, and commanded the high Priests and all their Council to come together: and he brought Paul, and set him before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul beheld earnestly the Council, and said, Men and brethren, I have in all good conscience served God until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high Priest Ananias commanded them that stood by, to smite him on the mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Paul to him, God will smite thee, thou whited wall: for thou sittest to judge me according to the Law, and transgressing the Law, commandest thou me to be smitten?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that stood by, said, Revilest thou God’s high Priest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Paul, I knew not brethren, that he was the high Priest: for it is written, Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were of the Sadducees, and the other of the Pharisees, he cried in the Council, Men and brethren, I am a Pharisee, the son of a Pharisee: I am accused of the hope and resurrection of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had said this, there was a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees, so that the multitude was divided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither Angel, nor spirit: but the Pharisees confess both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there was a great cry: and the Scribes of the Pharisees’ part rose up, and strove, saying, We find none evil in this man: but if a spirit or an Angel hath spoken to him, let us not fight against God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when there was a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them, commanded the soldiers to go down, and take him from among them, and to bring him into the castle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the night following, the Lord stood by him, and said, Be of good courage, Paul, for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the day was come, certain of the Jews made an assembly, and bound themselves with a curse, saying, that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were more than forty, which had made this conspiracy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to the chief Priests and Elders, and said, We have bound ourselves with a solemn curse, that we will eat nothing, until we have slain Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, ye and the Council, signify to the chief captain, that he bring him forth unto you tomorrow, as though you would know something more perfectly of him, and we, or ever he come near will be ready to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Paul’s sister’s son heard of their laying await, he went, and entered into the castle, and told Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul called one of the Centurions unto him, and said, Take this young man hence unto the chief captain: for he hath a certain thing to show him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he took him, and brought him to the chief captain, and said, Paul the prisoner called me unto him, and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee, which hath something to say unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief captain took him by the hand, and went apart with him alone, and asked him, What hast thou to show me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, The Jews have conspired to desire thee, that thou wouldest bring forth Paul tomorrow into the Council, as though they would inquire somewhat of him more perfectly:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let them not persuade thee: for there lie in wait for him of them, more than forty men, which have bound themselves with a curse, that they will neither eat nor drink, till they have killed him: and now are they ready, and wait for thy promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief captain then let the young man depart, after he had charged him to utter it to no man, that he had showed him these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called unto him two certain Centurions, saying, Make ready two hundred soldiers, that they may go to Caesarea, and horsemen threescore and ten, and two hundred with darts, at the third hour of the night:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let them make ready an horse, that Paul being set on, may be brought safe unto Felix the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he wrote an Epistle in this manner:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Claudius Lysias unto the most noble governor Felix sendeth greeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As this man was taken of the Jews, and should have been killed of them, I came upon them with a garrison, and rescued him, perceiving that he was a Roman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him forth into their Council.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There I perceived that he was accused of questions of their Law, but had no crime worthy of death, or of bonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was showed me, how that the Jews laid wait for the man, I sent him straightway to thee, and commanded his accusers to speak before thee the things that they had against him. Farewell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers as it was commanded them, took Paul, and brought him by night to Antipatris,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next day, they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned into the Castle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they came to Caesarea, they delivered the Epistle to the governor, and presented Paul also unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the Governor had read it, he asked of what province he was: and when he understood that he was of Cilicia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will hear thee, said he, when thine accusers also are come, and commanded him to be kept in Herod’s judgment hall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after five days, Ananias the high Priest came down with the Elders, and with Tertullus a certain orator, which appeared before the governor against Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was called forth, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, Seeing that we have obtained great quietness through thee, and that many worthy things are done unto this nation through thy providence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We acknowledge it wholly, and in all places, most noble Felix, with all thanks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that I be not tedious unto thee, I pray thee, that thou wouldest hear us of thy courtesy a few words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly we have found this man a pestilent fellow, and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world, and a chief maintainer of the sect of the Nazarenes:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And hath gone about to pollute the Temple: therefore we took him, and would have judged him according to our Law:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us, and with great violence took him out of our hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Commanding his accusers to come to thee: of whom thou mayest (if thou wilt inquire) know all these things whereof we accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Jews likewise affirmed, saying that it was so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul, after that the governor had beckoned unto him that he should speak, answered, I do the more gladly answer for myself, forasmuch as I know that thou hast been oft many years a judge unto this nation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing that thou mayest know, that there are but twelve days since I came up to worship in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they neither found me in the Temple, disputing with any man, neither making uproar among the people, neither in the Synagogues, nor in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither can they prove the things, whereof they now accuse me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this I confess unto thee, that after the way (which they call heresy) so worship I the God of my fathers, believing all things which are written in the Law and the Prophets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And have hope towards God, that the resurrection of the dead, which they themselves look for also, shall be both of just and unjust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And herein I endeavor myself to have always a clear conscience toward God and toward men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after many years, I came and brought alms to my nation and offerings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At what time, certain Jews of Asia found me purified in the Temple, neither with multitude, nor with tumult.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who ought to have been present before thee, and accuse me, if they had ought against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or let these themselves say, if they have found any unjust thing in me, while I stood in the Council,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Except it be for this one voice, that I cried standing among them, Of the resurrection of the dead am I accused of you this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Felix heard these things, he deferred them, and said, When I shall more perfectly know the things which concern this way, by the coming of Lysias the chief Captain, I will decide your matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he commanded a Centurion to keep Paul, and that he should have ease, and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister unto him, or to come unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after certain days, came Felix with his wife Drusilla, which was a Jewess, and he called forth Paul, and heard him of the faith in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he disputed of righteousness and temperance, and of the judgment to come, Felix trembled, and answered, Go thy way for this time, and when I have convenient time, I will call for thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul, that he might loose him: wherefore he sent for him the oftener, and communed with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When two years were expired, Porcius Festus came into Felix’s room, and Felix willing to get favor of the Jews, left Paul bound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Festus was then come into the province, after three days he went up from Caesarea unto Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high Priest, and the chief of the Jews appeared before him against Paul: and they besought him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And desired favor against him, that he would send for him to Jerusalem: and they laid wait to kill him by the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Festus answered, that Paul should be kept at Caesarea, and that he himself would shortly depart thither.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them therefore, said he, which among you are able, come down with us: and if there be any wickedness in the man, let them accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he had tarried among them no more than ten days, he went down to Caesarea, and the next day sat in the judgment seat, and commanded Paul to be brought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come, the Jews which were come from Jerusalem, stood about him and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul, whereof they could make no plain proof,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forasmuch as he answered, that he had neither offended anything against the law of the Jews, neither against the temple, nor against Caesar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet Festus willing to get favor of the Jews, answered Paul and said, Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these things before me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Paul, I stand at Caesar’s judgment seat, where I ought to be judged: to the Jews I have done no wrong, as thou very well knowest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I have done wrong, or committed anything worthy of death, I refuse not to die: but if there be none of these things, whereof they accuse me, no man, to pleasure them, can deliver me to them: I appeal unto Caesar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when Festus had spoken with the Council, he answered, Hast thou appealed unto Caesar? unto Caesar shalt thou go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after certain days, King Agrippa and Bernice came down to Caesarea to salute Festus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had remained there many days, Festus declared Paul’s cause unto the king, saying, There is a certain man left in prison by Felix,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of whom when I came to Jerusalem, the high Priests and Elders of the Jews informed me, and desired to have judgment against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom I answered, that it is not the manner of the Romans for favor to deliver any man to the death, before that he which is accused, have the accusers before him, and have place to defend himself, concerning the crime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when they were come hither, without delay the day following I sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Against whom when the accusers stood up, they brought no crime of such things as I supposed:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But had certain questions against him of their own superstitions, and of one Jesus which was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because I doubted of such manner of question, I asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because he appealed to be reserved to the examination of Augustus, I commanded him to be kept, till I might send him to Caesar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Agrippa said unto Festus, I would also hear the man myself. Tomorrow, said he, thou shalt hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the morrow when Agrippa was come, and Bernice with great pomp, and were entered into the Common hall with the chief captains and chief men of the city, at Festus’s commandment Paul was brought forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Festus said, King Agrippa, and all men which are present with us, ye see this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews have called upon me, both at Jerusalem, and here, crying, that he ought not to live any longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet have I found nothing worthy of death, that he hath committed: nevertheless, seeing that he hath appealed to Augustus, I have determined to send him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord: wherefore I have brought him forth unto you, and especially unto thee, King Agrippa, that after examination had, I might have somewhat to write.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For me thinketh it unreasonable to send a prisoner, and not to show the causes which are laid against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. So Paul stretched forth the hand, and answered for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I think myself happy, King Agrippa, because I shall answer this day before thee of all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chiefly, because thou hast knowledge of all customs, and questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As touching my life from my childhood, and what it was from the beginning among mine own nation at Jerusalem, know all the Jews,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which knew me heretofore, even from my Elders (if they would testify) that after the most straight sect of our religion, I lived a Pharisee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I stand and am accused for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whereunto our twelve tribes instantly serving God day and night, hope to come: for the which hope’s sake, O King Agrippa, I am accused of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should it be thought a thing incredible unto you, that God should raise again the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also verily thought in myself, that I ought to do many contrary things against the Name of Jesus of Nazareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which thing I also did in Jerusalem: for many of the Saints I shut up in prison, having received authority of the High Priests, and when they were put to death, I gave my sentence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I punished them throughout all the Synagogues, and compelled them to blaspheme and being more mad against them, I persecuted them, even unto strange cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At which time, even as I went to Damascus with authority, and commission from the high Priests,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven passing the brightness of the sun, shine round about me, and them which went with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, and saying in the Hebrew tongue, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? It is hard for thee to kick against pricks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, Who art thou, Lord? And he said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But rise and stand up on thy feet: for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose to appoint thee a minister and a witness, both of the things which thou hast seen, and of the things in the which I will appear unto thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Delivering thee from this people, and from the Gentiles, unto whom now I send thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To open their eyes, that they may turn from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins, and inheritance among them, which are sanctified by faith in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore, King Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But showed first unto them of Damascus, and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the coasts of Judea, and then to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, and do works worthy amendment of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this cause the Jews caught me in the Temple, and went about to kill me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, I obtained help of God, and continue unto this day, witnessing both to small and to great, saying none other things, than those which the Prophets and Moses did say should come,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To wit, that Christ should suffer, and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead, and should show light unto this people, and to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he thus answered for himself, Festus said with a loud voice, Paul, thou art beside thyself, much learning doth make thee mad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, I am not mad, O noble Festus, but I speak the words of truth, and soberness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the king knoweth of these things, before whom also I speak boldly: for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him: for this thing was [not] done in a corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O King Agrippa, believest thou the Prophets? I know that thou believest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Almost thou persuadest me to become a Christian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul said, I would to God that [not] only thou, but also all that hear me today, were both almost, and altogether such as I am, except these bonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had thus spoken, the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were gone apart, they talked between themselves, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death, nor of bonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Agrippa unto Festus, This man might have been loosed, if he had not appealed unto Caesar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when it was concluded, that we should sail into Italy, they delivered both Paul, and certain other prisoners unto a Centurion, named Julius, of the band of Augustus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we entered into a ship of Adramyttium, purposing to sail by the coasts of Asia, and launched forth, and had Aristarchus of Macedonia, a Thessalonian, with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next day we arrived at Sidon: and Julius courteously entreated Paul, and gave him liberty to go unto his friends, that they might refresh him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from thence we launched, and sailed hard by Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then sailed we over the sea by Cilicia, and Pamphilia, and came to Myra, a city in Lycia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there the Centurion found a ship of Alexandria, sailing into Italy, and put us therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had sailed slowly many days, and scarce were come against Cnidus, because the wind suffered us not, we sailed hard by Candia, near to Salmone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with much ado sailed beyond it, and came unto a certain place called the Fair Havens, near unto the which was the city Lasea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when much time was spent, and sailing was now jeopardous, because also the Fast was now passed, Paul exhorted them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto them, Sirs, I see that this voyage will be with hurt, and much damage, not of the lading and ship only, but also of our lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless the Centurion believed rather the governor and the master of the ship, than those things which were spoken of Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, many took counsel to depart thence, if by any means they might attain to Phoenix, there to winter, which is an haven of Crete, and lieth toward the Southwest and by West, and Northwest and by West.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Southern wind blew softly, they supposing to attain their purpose, loosed nearer, and sailed by Crete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But anon after, there arose by it a stormy wind called Euroclydon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the ship was caught, and could not resist the wind, we let her go, and were carried away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we ran under a little Isle named Clauda, and had much ado to get the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator
